## Getting Started

### Importing packages

For the purpose of this study, 6 R packages will be used.

They are sf, raster, spatstat, sparr, tmap, tidyverse.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pacman::p_load(sf, st, tidyverse, raster, tmap, spatstat, sparr, dplyr)
```
:::


### Importing Dataset

The file is in ESRI shapefile format.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
kbb <- st_read(dsn="data/rawdata",
               layer="Kepulauan_Bangka_Belitung")
```
:::


Next, we import the forest fire data which is in CSV format.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
fire_sf <- read_csv("data/rawdata/forestfires.csv") %>%
  st_as_sf(coords =c("longitude", "latitude"),
           crs = 4326) %>%
st_transform(crs = 32748)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Rows: 741 Columns: 15
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr   (3): satellite, instrument, daynight
dbl  (11): latitude, longitude, brightness, scan, track, acq_time, confidenc...
date  (1): acq_date

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
fire_sf <- fire_sf %>%
  mutate(DayofYear = yday(acq_date)) %>%
  mutate(Month_num = month(acq_date)) %>%
  mutate(Month_fac = month(acq_date,
                           label = TRUE,
                           abbr = FALSE))
```
:::


## Data Wrangling

if there are z entities, you most likely will have to drop it (it will cause issues to this exercise in this case)

The revised code chunk is as shown below.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
kbb_sf <- st_read(dsn="data/rawdata",
               layer="Kepulauan_Bangka_Belitung") %>%
st_union() %>%
  st_zm(drop = TRUE, what = "ZM") %>%
  st_transform(crs = 32748)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Reading layer `Kepulauan_Bangka_Belitung' from data source 
  `C:\jechaxu\IS415-GAA\In-class_Ex\data\rawdata' using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
Simple feature collection with 298 features and 27 fields
Geometry type: POLYGON
Dimension:     XYZ
Bounding box:  xmin: 105.1085 ymin: -3.116593 xmax: 106.8488 ymax: -1.501603
z_range:       zmin: 0 zmax: 0
Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
st_as_s2(): dropping Z and/or M coordinate
```


:::
:::


### Converting OWIN


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
kbb_owin <- as.owin(kbb_sf)
kbb_owin
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
window: polygonal boundary
enclosing rectangle: [512066.8, 705559.4] x [9655398, 9834006] units
```


:::
:::


`class()` is used to confirm if the output is indeed an owin object


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
class(kbb_owin)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] "owin"
```


:::
:::


## Overall Plot

always polygon first, followed by dot then line


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tm_shape(kbb_sf) +
  tm_polygons() +
tm_shape(fire_sf) +
  tm_dots()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-8-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tm_shape(kbb_sf) +
  tm_polygons() +
tm_shape(fire_sf) +
  tm_dots(size = 0.1) +
tm_facets(by = "Month_fac",
          free.coords = FALSE,
          drop.units = TRUE)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-9-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## Computing STKDE by month


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
fire_month <- fire_sf %>%
  dplyr::select(Month_num)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
fire_month_ppp <- as.ppp(fire_month)
fire_month_ppp
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Marked planar point pattern: 741 points
marks are numeric, of storage type  'double'
window: rectangle = [521564.1, 695791] x [9658137, 9828767] units
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
summary(fire_month_ppp)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Marked planar point pattern:  741 points
Average intensity 2.49258e-08 points per square unit

Coordinates are given to 10 decimal places

marks are numeric, of type 'double'
Summary:
   Min. 1st Qu.  Median    Mean 3rd Qu.    Max. 
  1.000   8.000   9.000   8.579  10.000  12.000 

Window: rectangle = [521564.1, 695791] x [9658137, 9828767] units
                    (174200 x 170600 units)
Window area = 29728200000 square units
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
any(duplicated(fire_month_ppp))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] FALSE
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
fire_month_owin <- fire_month_ppp[kbb_owin]
summary(fire_month_owin)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Marked planar point pattern:  741 points
Average intensity 6.424519e-08 points per square unit

Coordinates are given to 10 decimal places

marks are numeric, of type 'double'
Summary:
   Min. 1st Qu.  Median    Mean 3rd Qu.    Max. 
  1.000   8.000   9.000   8.579  10.000  12.000 

Window: polygonal boundary
2 separate polygons (no holes)
           vertices        area relative.area
polygon 1     47493 11533600000      1.00e+00
polygon 2       256      306427      2.66e-05
enclosing rectangle: [512066.8, 705559.4] x [9655398, 9834006] units
                     (193500 x 178600 units)
Window area = 11533900000 square units
Fraction of frame area: 0.334
```


:::
:::


### Computing Spatio-Temporal KDE


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
st_kde <- spattemp.density(fire_month_owin)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Calculating trivariate smooth...Done.
Edge-correcting...Done.
Conditioning on time...Done.
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
summary(st_kde)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Spatiotemporal Kernel Density Estimate

Bandwidths
  h = 15102.47 (spatial)
  lambda = 0.0304 (temporal)

No. of observations
  741 

Spatial bound
  Type: polygonal
  2D enclosure: [512066.8, 705559.4] x [9655398, 9834006]

Temporal bound
  [1, 12]

Evaluation
  128 x 128 x 12 trivariate lattice
  Density range: [1.233458e-27, 8.202976e-10]
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tims <- c(7, 8, 9, 10, 11, 12)
par(mfcol=c(2,3))
for (i in tims){
  plot(st_kde, i,
       override.par = FALSE,
       fix.range = TRUE,
       main = paste("KDE at month", i))
}
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-16-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


fire_yday_ppp \<- fire_sf %\>% select(DayofYear)

kde_yday \<- spattemp.density( fire_yday_owin) summary(kde_yday)

plot(kde_yday)
